metadata.title: CVE-2018-5124 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Unsanitized output in the browser UI leaves HTML tags in place and canresult in arbitrary code execution in Firefox before version 58.0.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
